data.title: ID Pool Upgrade Problem
data.solution:
n = gets.to_i
population = gets.to_i

hex = 16 ** n
base_36 = 36 ** n

hex_pass = hex >= population

max_population = hex_pass ? hex : base_36

puts hex_pass ? "hexadecimal" : "base 36"
puts max_population - population
data.statement:
You designed an ID pool for a network, where all identication numbers (ID's) are [[n]] digits long. However, now the number of users is suspected to reach [[population]] in the next week, which is more than the 10^[[n]] ID's available in the current pool!

Unfortunately, you can't increase the number of digits in the ID because of some hacky code in the back-end, so your only hope is allowing for the digits to go from <<decimal>> to  <<hexadecimal>> or even <<base 36>> if you have to!

Given the number of digits in the ID's [[n]] and the predicted [[population]], first print out either {{hexadecimal}} or {{base 36}} depending on which is needed to accomodate this population, and then print <<the number of 'spare' ID's>> (the maximum population minus the predicted population).
data.constraints:
0 < [[n]] < 10
10^[[n]] < [[population]] < 900,000,000
{{base 36}} will always work for the given tests
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read population:int
write hexadecimal or base 36
spare IDs (max population - population)

STATEMENT
ID Pool Upgrade by StepBack13!
population > 10**n (!)
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> [[n]], the number of digits in the ID's
<<Line 2 :>> [[population]], the number of users that will need ID's
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> Either {{hexadecimal}} or {{base 36}} if hexadecimal won't work
<<Line 2 :>> The <<number of 'spare' ID's>> using the new system

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You designed an ID pool for a network, where all identication numbers (ID's) are n digits long. However, now the number of users is suspected to reach population in the next week, which is more than the 10^n ID's available in the current pool!

Unfortunately, you can't increase the number of digits in the ID because of some hacky code in the back-end, so your only hope is allowing for the digits to go from decimal to hexadecimal or even base 36 if you have to!

Given the number of digits in the ID's n and the predicted population, first print out either hexadecimal or base 36 depending on which is needed to accomodate this population, and then print the number of 'spare' ID's (the maximum population minus the predicted population).
Input
Line 1 : n, the number of digits in the ID's
Line 2 : population, the number of users that will need ID's
Output
Line 1 : Either hexadecimal or base 36 if hexadecimal won't work
Line 2 : The number of 'spare' ID's using the new system
Constraints
0 < n < 10
10^n < population < 900,000,000
base 36 will always work for the given tests
Example
Input
1
13
Output
hexadecimal
3
